Therefore, the fluorescence response of SnO 2 QDs to heavy metal ions is controlled by the density of active Sn vacancies. Furthermore, it is likely to be correlated to several factors, such as adsorption energy and concentration of heavy metal ions as well as total density of surface Sn defects.
